Finally, the last term of Equation 1, reservoir evaporation, is computed from the reservoir storage using
6
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${Q}_{{\rm{evap}}}={\rm{\gamma }}S,$$\end{document}
Q
evap
= γ S ,
where γ (T −1) is a unitless evaporation coefficient dependent on climatic conditions and the surface area of the reservoir.
